quotes.quote: Never fear being a petty fool it means you ain't dying.
Beware of those who attribute petty instructions to God.
Gradually the feeling wears off, and I feel swamped again by the inexplicable pettiness of being alive.
I fly because it releases my mind from the tyranny of petty things.
Party loyalty lowers the greatest men to the petty level of the masses.
The art of giving orders is not to try to rectify the minor blunders and not to be swayed by petty doubts.
Reproof should not exhaust its power upon petty failings.
The petty man wants to use God for himself; the ambitious man wants God to use him for God.
The constant petty behests of life permit few opportunities for major satisfactions, and when one is offered it should be seized.
Our thoughts are broadcasts of the soul, not secrets of the brain. Kind ones bring us happiness; petty ones, untold pain.
Why, man, he doth bestride the narrow world. Like a Colossus; and we petty men. Walk under his huge legs, and peep about. To find ourselves dishonourable graves.
Petty things don't bother me as much as they used to.
The arch-flatterer, with whom all the petty flatterers have intelligence, is a man's self.
To be able to always have a super sense of who I was and my own real identity and be petty and seem informed and always thinking in thoughts would be great.
It is better to lose everything you have to keep the balance of justice level, than to live a life of petty privilege devoid of true freedom.
Petty mindedness instructs eyes to see everything from an appropriate standpoint, beautifulness could be looked otherwise.
Guilt is petty; I am above guilt.
Petty laws breed great crimes.
It's smallness is not petty; on the contrary, it is profound.
It is not true that suffering ennobles the character; happiness does that sometimes, but suffering for the most part, makes men petty and vindictive.
Great necessity elevates man, petty necessity casts him down.
The man of petty ambition if invited to dinner will be eager to be set next his host.
More than jealousy or possessiveness pettiness kills love.
Don't sweat the petty things and don't pet the sweaty things.
An ambition to excel in petty things obstructs the progress to nobler aims.

Mankind accepts good fortune as his due, but when bad occurs, he thinks it was aimed at him, done to him, a hex, a curse, a punishment by his deity for some transgression, as though his god were a petty storekeeper, counting up the day's receipts.
Good manners are made up of petty sacrifices.
I get so tired listening to one million dollars here, one million dollars there, it's so petty.
Don't be afraid of failure; be afraid of petty success.
Be master of your petty annoyances and conserve your energies for the big, worthwhile things. It isn't the mountain ahead that wears you out - it's the grain of sand in your shoe.
